image.altText: police officers and SES volunteers stand next to police vehicles on a cliff next to a beach

props.synopsis: Police have concluded a search for surfer Lance Appleby, who was killed in a shark attack in South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: Search ends for surfer attacked by shark as fundraiser soars past $80k

image.altText: A shot of an outback city taken from a hill with an orange sky in the background.

props.synopsis: Geoscience Australia says a string of three earthquakes near the outback mining city is unusual and that it's likely they are unrelated.

title.children: Three earthquakes hit Broken Hill region in less than two days

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of South Australia.

props.synopsis: Mark Adam Freer has been struck off the legal practitioner's roll for professional misconduct, including the misappropriation of trust money and creating a false affidavit.

title.children: Ex-lawyer struck off for theft, fabricating evidence

image.altText: A black and white photo of a church.

props.synopsis: Old churches are being transformed into shops, cafes, accommodation and breweries in South Australia, where small business owners are putting their heart and soul into preserving a part of history.

title.children: Small businesses breathe new life into historic churches

image.altText: A pregnant woman in a pink shirt looks at the camera, cows are in the background.

props.synopsis: Every fortnight, Peta Mackay has driven herself from her home in outback Corner Country to medical appointments in Adelaide. Finally, her due date is in sight.

title.children: High-risk pregnancy means 2,000km round trip for antenatal care

image.altText: Assistant Police Commissioner John De Candia at Glenelg

props.synopsis: Local traders at Glenelg show their support for a Declared Public Precinct trial that will see extended police powers.

title.children: SA Police have started a three-month Declared Public Precinct trial at Glenelg

image.altText: Swimmers in water at Penrith Beach

props.synopsis: How hot is too hot? The answer, according to leading heat health experts, can change dramatically based on the complex interactions between environmental factors in different postcodes.

title.children: Heat risk is complex and your postcode could be the determining factor

image.altText: Composite image of Iga Świątek  and Coco Gauff.

props.synopsis: Iga Świątek meets Coco Gauff in the United Cup final between Poland and the US, while Aryna Sabalenka contests the Brisbane International decider against Polina Kudermetova. Follow live.

title.children: Świątek faces Gauff in United Cup final, Sabalenka bids for first Brisbane title

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Brisbane International: Sabalenka wins second set to level final
United Cup: Gauff wins first set for US
Brisbane International: Kudermetova wins first set

image.altText: Smoke billowing above thick green scrubland with brown farmland in the background.

props.synopsis: A fire at Joanna, south of Naracoorte in South Australia's south-east, is burning through dense scrub and is inaccessible to firefighters ahead of a hot weekend.

title.children: SA firefighters on alert as blaze burns ahead of hot, windy weather

image.altText: A woman in Muslim dress with her hand on her forehead, looking shocked at a mound of rubble after an air strike

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden informs Congress of an $US8 billion ($13 billion) arms sale to Israel, according to US officials.

title.children: US plans $13 billion arms sale to Israel, US officials say

image.altText: A green car dangles its front over the edge of a collapsed bridge.

props.synopsis: Frank Manley remembers driving his family home across the Tasman Bridge at night but ahead of him the line markings disappeared into a dark abyss.

title.children: Fifty years on, Frank still avoids driving over the Tasman Bridge

image.altText: A group of firefighters discuss their tactics.

props.synopsis: High temperatures and unsettled weather could trigger dry lightning across Victoria on Sunday, as the state continues to swelter.

title.children: 'Tricky conditions' for firefighters as Victoria's heatwave continues

image.altText: Three young Indigenous men stand next to timber poles

props.synopsis: More than one in every 20 Wadeye residents is in jail, making it one of the most incarcerated communities in Australia.

title.children: In one of Australia's most imprisoned areas, some are breaking the cycle

image.altText: A man with a red face and a cap in front of a series of red concentric circles and white squiggly lines

props.synopsis: A succession of foreshocks and aftershocks are reshaping the geopolitical landscape. How will the global politics of 2025 be defined?

title.children: Tectonic events are reshaping global politics

image.altText: A mugshot of a bearded man in glasses

props.synopsis: Harold Shipman is suspected of killing more than 250 people over two decades. How did he get away with it for so long?

title.children: 'Unparalleled in history': Britain's worst serial killer murdered 250 people

image.altText: Hillary Clinton in red suit smiles as Joe Biden fastens medal of freedom around her neck

props.synopsis: The US president will award the Presidential Medal of Freedom to 19 of the nation's most famous names in politics, sports, entertainment, civil rights, LGBTQ+ advocacy and science.

title.children: Clinton, Soros and Wintour among those receiving top honours from Biden

image.altText: Half a plane washed up on a beach

props.synopsis: Authorities recover the bodies of two men who died in a plane crash off Nambucca Heads on the Coffs Harbour coast yesterday.

title.children: Two bodies recovered after light plane crash off NSW coast

image.altText: A white middle-aged man with white hair speaks to media with his hands open looking serious

props.synopsis: Karl Nehammer says he will resign as Austrian leader after coalition talks to form a government excluding the leading far-right party collapsed.

title.children: Austrian chancellor steps down as coalition talks collapse

image.altText: two young girls sitting on a rock looking out into the sunset with classes of wine

props.synopsis: When you think of summer holidays, it is easy to picture bustling beaches and busy shopping centres. But the outback's hibernation boasts a different, much quieter scene.

title.children: Outback towns enter hibernation amid exodus for summer tourist hotspots

image.altText: A politician wearing a suit jacket, speaking to media.

props.synopsis: Criminal gangs have become involved in the sale of illicit tobacco and illegal vapes despite numerous police raids, according to the Queensland government.

title.children: Government warns of vape sale gangs as opposition calls out budget delay

image.altText: back of a large navy blue oil tanker that reads eagle s in white lettering

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin has a collection of hundreds of rusting tankers covertly carrying Russian crude oil around the world, according to the European Union.

title.children: Russia's 'shadow fleet' could be sabotaging key EU infrastructure

image.altText: Soldiers in combat training.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Russian and North Korean forces have suffered heavy losses in fighting in Russia's southern Kursk region.

title.children: Russian and North Korean troops suffer heavy loses in Kursk, Zelenskyy says

image.altText: An illustration of a mother and two young children in a car, representing a family fleeing family violence.

props.synopsis: The housing crisis is having devastating impacts on the domestic violence sector, with women having fewer options for leaving and homelessness shelters filling up.

title.children: Packed homeless shelters leave women and children stranded

image.altText: A woman in front of a horse yard fence pats a horse in the yard.

props.synopsis: Many lessons came from the 2003 Canberra firestorm, including how to better care for horses during a bushfire emergency. This summer, horse owners are being urged to have emergency safety plans in place for their animals.

title.children: During Canberra's firestorm, Jane protected horses. She wishes she hadn't

image.altText: A close up of Jeff Baena and Aubrey Plaza smilling for photographers

props.synopsis: The Los Angeles County Medical Examiner's Office is investigating the indie filmmaker's death.

title.children: Jeff Baena, Hollywood writer and husband of Aubrey Plaza, dies aged 47

image.altText: A board showing stocks being traded on the Australian Securities Exchange with people walking in the distance.

props.synopsis: A lifetime to build. A day to destroy. Companies shatter reputations at their peril.

title.children: Why don't companies understand how important reputation is?

image.altText: A beach showing significant signs of erosion.

props.synopsis: The beach at Inverloch, two hours south-east of Melbourne, is receding at a rate of around 10 metres a year. Locals say it's time the state government took hard action.

title.children: Residents at beach holiday hotspot rally for urgent erosion solution

image.altText: graphic of photos of Deborah and headlines about her murder

props.synopsis: Deborah Smykalla was brutally murdered on Father's Day, 1981. Her killer has never been found.

title.children: Sister of murdered Brisbane woman chases leads after case runs cold

image.altText: woman starting a push mower

props.synopsis: A lot of people want to swoop in early in the morning so they can enjoy the rest of the weekend basking in the glow of their freshly mowed lawn. But how early is too early to pull-start the motor?

title.children: What time are you allowed to start mowing the lawn on a weekend?

image.altText: Young boy salutes as the hearse carrying the flag-draped casket of former President Jimmy Carter drives down road

props.synopsis: Former US president Jimmy Carter is being honoured following his death last week at the age of 100, with six days of funeral arrangements underway.

title.children: Thousands line streets as former US president Carter's funeral begins

image.altText: Man in wheelchair, wearing black clothing and cap, sitting by pool

props.synopsis: Over the past 10 years, 55 men have drowned after jumping into the water from a height in Australia. Ash Treseder almost became one of them, and is urging others not to take the risk this summer.

title.children: Quadriplegic urges people not to jetty jump this summer

image.altText: Firefighters are seen fighting a smokey fire on a freeway with the Melbourne skyline in the background.

props.synopsis: Dozens of people are evacuated from their homes after firefighters respond to a blaze in Nunawading overnight.

title.children: Firefighters battle suspicious blazes across Melbourne

image.altText: elderly woman sits next to balloons wearing grey cardigan

props.synopsis: Japanese woman Tomiko Itooka was the world’s oldest person according to Guinness World Records.

title.children: World's oldest person Tomiko Itooka, born in 1908, dies aged 116
